    Golden Powder

    The calamity of impurities arises from the imbalance of the heart and kidneys, water and fire. This can occur due to indulgence in wine and lust, leading to excess, which is referred to as soil indulgence. The heart has empty heat while the kidney is deficient, thus the soil evil affects the water. Historical records have mentioned that in summer, the soil is dry and the water is impure; in winter, the soil is firm and the water is clear—this is the principle behind it. Physicians often prescribe harsh tonics, but this can worsen the condition. This formula harmonizes and is taken to ensure that water and fire are balanced, and thus the soil becomes firm and the flow is clear.

    Ingredients:

    • Ginseng: 2 taels
    • Dragon bone (calcined): 1 tael
    • White poria: 2 taels
    • Loranthus: 2 taels

    Grind the above into fine powder. Take one qian (3.1 grams) each time, and mix with rice wine on an empty stomach, taking another dose before sleeping.

    Kanli Dan

    This balances water and fire, nourishes the heart and kidneys, and stops white discharge and nocturnal emissions.

    • Sour jujube seed: 1 tael
    • Cinnabar: 1 tael
    • Frankincense: 0.5 tael
    • Aconite: 1 piece (peel off the skin and navel)

    Grind the above into fine powder and mix well. Refine honey to form pills the size of chicken heads. Take five pills each time, with warm wine or lampwick soup. It should be made in the twelfth lunar month and stored in ceramic containers.[95p]

    　　三仙丸　治梦泄。
    　　益智仁二两，用盐二两炒，去盐　乌药一两半，炒　山药一两，为末打糊　　右为细末，用山药末煮糊和丸如梧桐子大。每服五十丸，空心临睡用盐汤送下，以朱砂末为衣。凡病精泄不禁，自汗头眩，虚极，或寒或热，用补濇之药不效，其脉浮软而散，盖非虚也，亦非房室过度。此无他，心有所睹，因有所慕，意有所乐，欲想方兴，不遂所欲而致斯疾。既以药补且固，不效，将何治之？缘心有爱则神不归，意有想则志不宁。当先和荣卫，荣卫和则心安；次调其脾，脾气和则志舍定。心肾交媾，精神内守，其病自愈。其法用人参三钱，当归一钱，洗焙为末，作三服，糯米饮调服，服毕自汗止而寒热退。头眩未除，川芎三钱，人参一钱焙为末，作三服，沸汤调服，头眩遂瘥。精不禁者用白芍药半两，丁香、木香各三钱，銼散，每服用生姜五片，枣二枚，以水同煎，空心服，即心安神定，精固神悦。[96p]

    Sanxian Pills for Treating Dream Emission

    Two taels of Yizhi Ren, stir-fried with two taels of salt and then remove the salt; one and a half taels of Wuyao, stir-fried; one tael of Shanyao, ground into powder. Mix the finely ground Shanyao with broth to form pills the size of phoenix seeds. Take fifty pills on an empty stomach before sleeping, washed down with salt water, coated with powdered cinnabar.

    For conditions of seminal emission that cannot be controlled, accompanied by spontaneous sweating, dizziness, extreme weakness, or alternating chills and fever, if tonic herbs are ineffective, and the pulse is floating, soft, and scattered, it is not merely deficiency, nor is it simply due to excessive indulgence in sexual activities. The cause is the heart's perceptions, leading to desire and joy in the mind, which stirs up intentions that do not align with one’s will, resulting in this illness. If the medicine does not work to replenish and strengthen, what else can be done? It is because when the heart has attachments, the spirit cannot return; when the mind has desires, the will cannot settle.

    First, harmonize the Defensive and Nutritive Qi; when these are harmonious, the heart will be at peace. Next, regulate the Spleen; when the Spleen's energy is harmonious, the will can stabilize. When the heart and kidneys interact intimately, the spirit within guards itself, and the illness will heal naturally.

    For this, use three qian of Ren Shen and one qian of Dang Gui, wash and fry them into powder, and make three doses mixed with glutinous rice drink. After taking this, spontaneous sweating will stop, and chill and heat will retreat. If dizziness persists, use three qian of Chuan Xiong and one qian of Ren Shen, fry into powder and make three doses mixed with boiling water. After taking this, dizziness will resolve.

    For those with uncontrolled emissions, use half a tael of Bai Shao, and three qian each of Ding Xiang and Mu Xiang, ground to a fine powder. Each dose should be taken with five slices of fresh ginger and two dates, boiled together in water. Taken on an empty stomach, this will calm the heart, settle the spirit, strengthen the essence, and bring joy to the spirit.[96p]

    Tianxiong Powder: Treats loss of essence.
    Tianxiong Pill: Three taels of dragon bone, eight taels of white atractylodes, six taels of cinnamon branch. Crush these four ingredients into a powder. Take half a money's worth with wine, thrice daily. If symptoms persist, gradually increase the dosage.

    Huashi Powder (from "Zhi Zhi Fang"): Treats painful conditions of sand and stone, as if being cut.
    Three qian each of talc and gypsum, two qian each of stone calamus, shiny locust, akebia fruit, and Sichuan mallow seeds. Grind to a powder. Take two qian per dose, with two stalks of scallion white, a fistful of lampwick, and a spoonful of honey, decocted in water and taken on an empty stomach.

    Borosilicate Powder: Treats acute pain from sand and stone.
    Three qian each of boron salt, amber, red poria, Sichuan mallow seeds, and dried tangerine peel. Grind to a powder. For each dose of two qian, use one stalk of scallion white, twenty grains of ophiopogon, and a spoonful of honey, decocted in water and taken on an empty stomach.

    Qiushi Pill (from "Zhi Zhi Fang"): Treats turbid qi obstructing clarity, resulting in essence dispersing into a thick and viscous fluid, appearing yellow, red, white, and dark, resembling thick oil or honey.
    One liang of white poria, five qian each of dried silkworm root, deer antler glue, and autumn stone. Grind these into a powder, mix with sticky rice paste to form pills the size of a walnut. Take with ginseng decoction, fifty pills at a time.

    Xiang'er Powder (from "Zhong Xing"): Treats blood and sand dysuria, where the fluid resembles a line and pain feels like being cut with a knife.
    Five fen of musk, one stalk of scallion white, crushed together to extract juice, two and a half fen of amber, and three and a half qian of chickweed. Grind to a powder, mix with boiling water, add scallion juice, and take on an empty stomach for miraculous effects.[101p]

    Xie Shen Decoction
    For those experiencing severe lower abdominal swelling and urgency from dysuria, this is recommended.
    Ingredients:

    • Da Huang (Rhubarb) 6 grams, ground, soaked in water overnight
    • Mu Li (Magnetite) 4.5 grams, crushed
    • Shi Chang Pu (Acorus calamus) 3 grams
    • Sheng Di Huang (Rehmannia glutinosa) 3 grams
    • Yuan Shen (Polygala) 2.4 grams
    • Xi Xin (Asarum) 2.4 grams
    • Mang Xiao (Sodium sulfate) 1.8 grams
    • Chi Fu Ling (Poria) 1.8 grams
    • Huang Qin (Scutellaria) 1.8 grams
    • Gan Cao (Licorice) 1.6 grams
      Prepare the above by grinding, add 480 ml of water, boil until reduced to 360 ml. Add Da Huang and continue simmering until reduced to 270 ml. Strain, mix in Mang Xiao, and take on an empty stomach.

    Zi Shi Qing Pills
    For treating phthisis, nightmares of interacting with ghosts, and severe loss of essence leading to exhaustion.
    Ingredients:

    • She Xiang (Musk) 15 grams, ground
    • Zi Shi Qing (Amethyst) 60 grams, powdered
    • Sang Piao Xiao (Seahorse) 60 grams, roasted
    • Ren Shen (Ginseng) 60 grams
    • Long Gu (Dragon Bone) 60 grams
    • Bai Zi Ren (Platycladus) 60 grams, separately ground
    • Zhu Sha (Cinnabar) 15 grams, finely ground and powdered
    • Rou Cong Rong (Cistanche) 30 grams, soaked in wine overnight, scraped of wrinkles and dried
      Combine all ingredients into fine powder, mix evenly, and knead with honey to form pills the size of a wutong seed. Take 20 pills with warm wine before meals.

    Chenxiang Pill - Treats damp-heat (gāo lín).
    Sandalwood, meat of the flesh from the cistanches steeped in wine, chopped and roasted; spikes of Schizonepeta; Astragalus; magnetite fire calcined, dissolved and quenched three times; talcum, each one tael. Grind these into a powder, and form into pills about the size of a tung seed. Take thirty pills each time, swallow with warm wine.

    Magnetite Pill - Treats damp-heat (gāo lín).
    Alisma, meat of the flesh from the cistanches steeped in wine, skins removed, chopped and roasted; talcum powder; magnetite fire calcined, dissolved and quenched three times, each one tael. Method of taking the pills is the same as above.

    Hai Jin Sha San - Treats damp-heat (gāo lín).
    Hai Jin Sha and talcum, each one tael, ground into powder; licorice two and a half qian, also ground into powder. Mix well; take two qian each time, decoct in a soup of Ophiopogon before eating, a lamp wick soup is also acceptable.

    Di Huang Wan - Treats kidney deficiency, labor-related bladder clumping, and dribbling.
    Fresh Rehmannia cut and roasted, Astragalus one and a half taels; Fang Feng, Huang Qin, Yuan Zhi, licorice boiled in water; Poria cocos cleansed of wood; antler cured and roasted (to remove fur); (Herba Trichosanthis) each one tael; stone reed, angelica roasted; each half a tael; red peony, powdered salt, bulrush pollen, licorice roasted; each seven and a half qian; Plantago seed, talcum each two taels; Ginseng one tael two and a half qian. Grind these into a fine powder, grind honey into pills the size of a tung seed. Take twenty pills each time, swallow with warm wine before eating, salt soup is also acceptable.[103p]

    Difuzi Decoction (from "Jisheng Fang")

    Used for various illnesses post-recovery, with weakened body experiencing heat, leading to a heat blockage in the lower body, resulting in stranguria. Symptoms include red, scanty urination, frequent urges with minimal output, sharp pain in the penis, or blood in the urine.

    Ingredients:

    • Difuzi (pale flower) - 1.5 qian
    • Zhuling (polypore) - 1.5 qian
    • Daohua (seaweed) - rinse off salt
    • Tongcao (plantain) - 1 qian
    • Gancao (licorice root) - 1 qian (sprouts)
    • Qumai (sorghum) - remove stems - 1 qian
    • Huangqin (scutellaria) - 1 qian
    • Zhimu (anemarrhenae rhizome) - 1 qian
    • Zhishi (bitter orange) - fried - 1 qian
    • Shengma (cimicifuga) - 1 qian
    • Kuizi (sunflower seeds) - 1 qian

    Mix all for one dose, using two jugs of water and three slices of ginger, simmer to one jug. Take at any time. Note: "Qian Jin Fang" does not include Gancao sprouts.

    Shiwai San (from "Heji Ju Fang")

    Treats kidney qi deficiency, bladder heat, water path blockage, and strangury not being discharged properly. Symptoms include scant urination with frequent urges, sharp pain in the navel and abdomen, feelings of fullness, and aggravation with fatigue, also possible urination resembling bean juice or excretion of sand and gravel.

    Ingredients:

    • Shaoyao (peony) - 2 liang
    • Baizhu (white atractylodes) - 2 liang
    • Huashi (talc) - 2 liang
    • Kuizi (sunflower seeds) - 2 liang
    • Qumai (sorghum) - 2 liang (remove hairs)
    • Mutong (clematis) - 2 liang
    • Danggui (angelica) - 1 liang
    • Gancao (licorice, roasted) - 1 liang
    • Wangbuliao (seed of the gallium) - 1 liang

    Grind to fine powder. Each dose: 2 qian, decoct with wheat soup and take warm, two to three times a day on an empty stomach. Note: "Qian Jin Fang" does not include Danggui; it treats all types of strangury.[104p]

    　　地黄丸　治心肾水火不济，或因酒色，遂至已甚，谓之土淫。盖脾有虚热而肾不足，故土邪干水，先贤常言夏则土燥而水浊，冬则土坚而水清，此其理也。医者往往峻补，其疾反甚。此方中和，水火既济，而土自坚，其流清矣。　　熟地黄十两，九蒸九曝　附子炮去皮脐，一两　菟丝子酒浸晒干　鹿角霜各五两　白茯苓　柏子仁各三两　　右为细末，另用鹿角胶煮糊为丸如梧桐子大。每服一百丸，空心用盐酒送下。[112p]

    Water and Land Two Immortals Pill treats turbidity.

    Wash and clean the seeds of the gold cherry fruit, steam them until cooked, and pour broth over them. Extract the juice into a silver basin and simmer slowly until it becomes a thin paste. Grind the flesh of the water chestnut into powder, combining equal parts. Mix the previous paste with wine to make pills the size of large paulownia seeds. Take thirty pills with warm wine before meals. An alternative method uses milk pills taken with salty broth.

    The Rehmannia Pill treats the imbalance of water and fire in the heart and kidneys, which may be exacerbated by indulgence in wine and lust, termed "earthly indulgence." This occurs because of excessive heat in the spleen and insufficient energy in the kidneys, resulting in the earth disrupting the water; wise sages often say that in summer, the earth is dry and the water turbid, while in winter, the earth is solid and the water clear, which reflects this principle. Doctors often prescribe harsh tonics, but this may worsen the condition. This formula harmonizes the balance of water and fire, allowing the earth to stabilize and the flow to clear.

    Ingredients: ten taels of prepared rehmannia, steamed and sun-dried nine times; one tael of prepared aconite, removing the skin and navel; five taels each of dodder seed, dried after soaking in wine, and antler frost; three taels each of white poria and arborvitae seed.

    Grind these into fine powder, and separately prepare antler glue into a paste to shape into pills the size of large paulownia seeds. Take one hundred pills on an empty stomach with salty wine.[112p]

    　　子午丸　治心肾俱虚，梦寐惊悸，体常自汗，烦闷短气，悲忧不乐，消渴引饮，漩下赤白停凝浊甚，四肢无力，面黄肌瘦，耳鸣眼昏，头运恶风，怯寒，并皆治之。　　榧子肉二两　莲肉去心　枸杞子　白龙骨　巴戟　破故纸炒　琥珀另研　楮实　白矾枯　赤茯苓　白茯苓　莲花须盐蒸　白牡蛎煅　芡实　文蛤各一两　朱砂一两半，另研为末　　右为细末，用肉苁蓉一斤二两，酒蒸烂研膏和丸如桐子大，朱砂为衣。每服五十丸，空心浓煎萆薢汤下。　　忌劳力房事，专心服饵，渴止浊清，奇效。[113p]

    Zi Wu Wan treats the dual deficiency of heart and kidney, restless dreams, palpitations, spontaneous sweating, irritability and shortness of breath, melancholy and unhappiness, excessive thirst with a desire to drink, severe stagnation and turbid discharge, weakness of the limbs, pale face with emaciation, tinnitus and blurred vision, sensitivity to wind, fear of cold, all of which are treated.

    Avoid exertion and sexual activities, focus on taking the medicine, drink clear water until thirst is quenched, and you will see remarkable results.[113p]

    Xiao Wen Jin San: This formula treats deficiency heat in the heart and kidneys, symptoms such as red or white painful urination, and spontaneous sweating at times.

    Zuo Gui Wan (from "Jing Yue Quanshu"): This formula treats the insufficiency of true yin and kidney water, which fails to nourish the defensive and nutritive qi, leading to progressive weakness, resulting in cloudy urination and seminal leakage.     　　右归丸　治元阳不足，或先天禀衰，或劳伤过度，以致命门火衰，不能生土，而为淋浊遗精等证。　　大怀熟地黄八两　山药炒　枸杞微炒　菟丝子制　鹿角胶炒珠　杜仲姜汁炒，各四两　山萸微炒　当归各三两，便溏勿用　肉桂二两，渐可加至四两　制附子自二两渐可加至五六两　　右，丸法如前，或丸如弹子大。每嚼服二三丸，以滚白汤送下，其效尤速。

    Right Returning Pill: Treats insufficiency of the primal yang, whether caused by congenital weakness or excessive labor, resulting in the decline of the gate of life fire, which fails to generate earth, leading to symptoms such as turbid residual essence.     Five Blessings Drink: For loss of qi and blood in the five organs leading to nocturnal emissions, this can treat them all, deserving to be called the greatest of royal prescriptions. Ingredients: 2 to 3 qian of Angelica, 1.5 qian of fried Atractylodes, 1 qian of honey-fried licorice, and suitable amounts of ginseng and cooked Rehmannia. Use 2 sheng of water, decoct to 7 parts, and take warm away from meals. Optionally add 3 to 5 slices of fresh ginger. This serves as the primary treatment for conditions involving simultaneous deficiency of qi and blood. For those who are prone to cold, add ginger or Aconite; for those needing dispersal, add Cimicifuga or Pueraria. One can draw from both sides, with no negative effects.[115p]

    　　加减一阴煎　此治水亏火胜之剂，故曰一阴。凡肾水真阴虚损，而脉证多阳虚火发热，及阴虚遗浊等证。　　生地　芍药　麦冬各二钱　熟地三五钱　炙甘草五七分　知母　地骨皮各一钱　　水二锺，煎服。

    Jia Jian Yi Yin Decoction: This is a remedy for treating the deficiency of water and the excess of fire, hence called "One Yin." It is used when the true kidney water is deficient, and the pulse signs often indicate excess yang and fire heat, as well as symptoms of yin deficiency and residual turbidity. Ingredients: 2 dimes of sheng di (fresh rehmannia), shao yao (peony), and mai dong (ophiopogon); 3-5 dimes of shu di (prepared rehmannia); 5-7 fen of zhi gan cao (honey-fried licorice); 1 dime each of zhi mu (anemarrhena) and di gu pi (lycium root). Add 2 sheng of water and decoct.

    Er Yin Decoction: This treats the heat in the heart related to dampness and residual sperm, where water fails to control fire; hence called "Two Yin." Ingredients: 2-3 dimes of sheng di and mai dong; 2 dimes of jujube seed; 1 dime each of sheng gan cao and huang lian (coptis); 1.5 dimes each of yuan shen (salvia) and fu ling (poria), and mu tong (clematis). Add 2 sheng of water and twenty pieces of lamp wick, or bamboo leaves are acceptable. Decoction is to be reduced by 30% and taken away from meals.

    Ling Zhu Er Chen Decoction: This treats phlegm and water retention in the chest, causing nausea, sour regurgitation, and white turbidity with residual sperm. Ingredients: 1.5 dimes each of zhu ling (polyporus), ze xie (alismatis), and fu ling; 2-3 dimes of ban xia (pinellia); 8 fen of zhi gan cao; 1-2 dimes of gan jiang (dried ginger, roasted yellow) and bai zhu (white atractylodes); 1 dime of chen pi (aged tangerine peel). Add 1.5 sheng of water and decoct.

    Xiao Fen Qing Drink: This treats mild water issues, such as troubles with urination and damp turbidity; this formula is the main approach for it. Ingredients: 2-3 dimes each of fu ling, ze xie, and zhu ling; 2 dimes of yi ren (job's tears); 1 dime each of zhi ke (bitter orange) and hou po (magnolia bark). Add 1.5 sheng of water and decoct (reducing by 30%) to be taken before meals.[116p]

    　　抽薪饮　治淋浊遗精，火炽盛而不宜补者。　　黄芩　石斛　木通　栀子炒　黄蘗各一二钱　枳壳　泽泻各钱半　细甘草三分　　水一锺半，煎七分，食远温服。内热甚者，冷服佳。
    　　徙薪饮　治一切内热未甚者，宜以此剂。甚者宜抽薪饮。　　陈皮八分　黄芩二钱　麦冬　芍药　黄蘗　茯苓　牡丹皮各一钱半　　水一锺半，煎七分，食远温服。

    　　大分清饮　治积热闭结，淋闭等证。　　茯苓　泽泻　木通各二钱　猪苓　栀子或倍之　枳壳　车前子各一钱　　水一锺半，煎八分，食远温服。

    　　菉豆饮　凡火热极不能退者，用此最妙。　　菉豆不拘多寡，宽汤煮糜烂
    　　右入盐少许，或蜜亦可，待冰冷，或厚、或稀、或汤，任意饮食之，日或三四次不拘。此物性非苦寒，不伤脾气，且善于解毒除烦，退热止渴，大利小水，乃浅易中之最佳最捷者也。若火盛口甘，不宜厚味，但略煮半熟，清汤冷饮之尤善，除烦清火。[117p]

    Chou Xin Drink: Treats damp heat and involuntary seminal emissions; when the heat is intense and unsuitable for tonifying. Ingredients: 1-2 qian of Huang Qin, Shi Hu, Mu Tong, and Zhi Zi (stir-fried), and Huang Bai; 0.5 qian of Zhi Ke and Ze Xie; 3 fen of Xiao Gan Cao. Prepare with 1.5 zhong of water, decoct to 7 parts, and take warm after meals. For severe internal heat, it’s better to take it cold.

    Xi Xin Drink: Used for all types of internal heat that is not severe; this formula is appropriate. For more severe cases, use Chou Xin Drink. Ingredients: 8 fen of Chen Pi, 2 qian of Huang Qin, and 1.5 qian each of Mai Dong, Shao Yao, Huang Bai, Fu Ling, and Mu Dan Pi. Prepare with 1.5 zhong of water, decoct to 7 parts, and take warm after meals.

    Da Fen Qing Drink: Treats accumulated heat blockages, urinary difficulties, and similar conditions. Ingredients: 2 qian each of Fu Ling, Ze Xie, and Mu Tong; 1 qian each of Zhu Ling, Zhi Zi (or double the amount), Zhi Ke, and Che Qian Zi. Prepare with 1.5 zhong of water, decoct to 8 parts, and take warm after meals.

    Lu Dou Drink: Used for extreme heat that cannot be alleviated. Lu Dou can be used in any quantity; boil with ample water until it becomes soft. Add a little salt or honey as desired, then let it cool. It can be thick or thin, as soup, for consumption freely, 3-4 times a day without restriction. This substance is not bitter and cold; it does not harm spleen qi, effectively detoxifies, alleviates frustration, reduces fever, quenches thirst, and promotes urination. It is the best and quickest remedy among the simple ones. If there is intense heat with a sweet mouth, avoid heavy flavors; instead, lightly cook to half done and drink the cool broth, which is especially good for clearing heat and alleviating irritation.[117p]

    　　五君子煎　治脾胃虚寒，土湿淋浊者。　　人参二三钱　白朮黄土炒　白茯苓各二钱　炙甘草一钱　干姜炒黄，一二钱　　水一锺半，煎服。

    　　寿脾煎　一名摄营煎。治脾虚不能摄血等证。　　白朮二三钱　当归　山药各二钱　枣仁钱半　炙甘草一钱　远志制，三五分　干姜炮，二三钱　莲肉去心炒，二十粒　人参一二钱，急者用一两　　水二锺，煎服。

    　　秘元煎　治遗精带浊等证。此方专主心脾。　　远志炒，八分　山药炒　芡实炒　金樱子去核　枣仁炒捣碎，各二钱　白朮炒　茯苓各钱半　炙甘草一钱　人参一二钱　五味十四粒，畏酸者去之　　水二锺，煎七分，食远服。此治久遗无火，不动而滑者，乃可用之。如尚有火觉热者，加苦参一二钱。[118p]

    Wujunzi Decoction: Treats symptoms of spleen and stomach deficiency cold, with dampness and turbid phlegm. Ingredients: 2-3 qian of ginseng, 2 qian each of white atractylodes and yellow earth (cooked), 2 qian of white poria, 1 qian of honey-fried licorice, and 1-2 qian of dry ginger (fried). Use 1.5 sheng of water, decoct and take.

    Shoupi Decoction: Also known as Sheying Decoction. Treats symptoms of spleen deficiency unable to hold blood, among others. Ingredients: 2-3 qian of white atractylodes, 2 qian each of dang gui and Chinese yam, 0.5 qian of jujube seed, 1 qian of honey-fried licorice, 0.3-0.5 qian of yuan zhi (prepared), 2-3 qian of dry ginger (roasted), 20 pieces of lotus seeds (heart removed and fried), and 1-2 qian of ginseng (1 liang for urgent cases). Use 2 sheng of water, decoct and take.

    Miyuan Decoction: Treats symptoms of spermatorrhea with turbid discharge. This formula specifically targets the heart and spleen. Ingredients: 0.8 qian of fried yuan zhi, 2 qian each of fried Chinese yam, fried coix seed, pitted gold cherry, and fried jujube seed (crushed); 0.5 qian each of fried white atractylodes and poria, 1 qian of honey-fried licorice, 1-2 qian of ginseng, and 14 pieces of five-flavor fruit (omit if sour). Use 2 sheng of water, decoct to 7 parts, and take on an empty stomach. This treats chronic spermatorrhea without heat, where there is no movement and it flows continuously. If there is a sensation of heat, add 1-2 qian of bitter coptis.[118p]

    　　固阴煎　治阴虚滑泄，带浊淋遗等证，此方专主肝肾。　　人参随宜　熟地黄三五钱　山药炒二钱　山茱萸一钱半　远志炒，七分　炙甘草一二钱　五味十四粒　菟丝子炒香，二三钱　　水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。

    　　菟丝煎　治心脾气弱，凡遇思虑劳倦，即苦遗精者，宜此。　　人参二三钱　山药炒，二钱　当归　枣仁炒　茯苓各钱半　菟丝子制，四五钱　远志制，四分　炙甘草一钱或五分　　右，用水十锺半，煎成加鹿鱼霜末四五匙调服，食前。或加白朮一二钱。
    　　苓朮菟丝丸　治脾肾虚损，不能收摄，以致梦遗精滑及困倦等证。　　白茯苓　白朮米泔洗炒　莲肉去心，各四两　五味酒蒸　山药炒，各二两　杜仲酒炒，三两　菟丝子淘净酒浸一日，煮极烂，捣为饼，焙干，十两　炙甘草五钱　　右用山药末，以陈酒煮糊为丸梧子大。空心滚白汤或酒下百余丸。[119p]

    Gu Yin Jian treats symptoms of Yin deficiency and slippery leakage, such as vaginal discharge or urinary disorders, focusing on the liver and kidneys.
    Ingredients:

    • Ginseng, appropriate amount
    • Cooked Rehmannia, 30-50 grams
    • Fried Chinese Yam, 20 grams
    • Cornelian Cherry, 15 grams
    • Fried Polygala, 7 grams
    • Honey-fried Licorice, 10-20 grams
    • Schisandra, 14 berries
    • Fried Cuscuta Seed, 20-30 grams
    • Water, 600 ml, simmer until reduced to 300 ml, take warm before meals.

    Tu Si Jian treats weakness of the heart and spleen qi. It is suitable for those who experience thoughts and fatigue leading to sperm leakage.
    Ingredients:

    • Ginseng, 20-30 grams
    • Fried Chinese Yam, 20 grams
    • Angelica, 15 grams
    • Fried Jujube Seed, 15 grams
    • Poria, 15 grams
    • Processed Cuscuta Seed, 40-50 grams
    • Processed Polygala, 4 grams
    • Honey-fried Licorice, 10 or 5 grams
      Prepare with 10.5 cups of water, and simmer until complete. Add four to five spoonfuls of deer fish powder for a restorative mixture, to be taken before meals. Optionally, add Bai Zhu, 10-20 grams.

    Ling Zhu Tu Si Wan treats spleen and kidney deficiencies that cannot control and lead to nocturnal emissions and fatigue.
    Ingredients:

    • White Poria, 200 grams
    • Bai Zhu rice washed and stir-fried, 200 grams
    • Lotus flesh without seeds, 200 grams
    • Schisandra, 200 grams
    • Fried Chinese Yam, 100 grams
    • Stir-fried Eucommia in wine, 150 grams
    • Cuscuta Seed soaked and steamed, extremely soft, then pounded into a cake and dried, 1000 grams
    • Honey-fried Licorice, 25 grams
      Prepare using the yam powder, boiled with aged wine to form pills the size of a walnut. Take 100 pills with warm water or wine on an empty stomach.[119p]

    淋浊遗精门

    　　小便淋痛：用真定瓷器煅研二两，生熟地黄末各一两，每用二钱，木通煎汤服。 【《适用方》】
    　　卒淋不通：好墨烧一两为末，每服一钱，温水服。 【《普济方》】
    　　小便气淋：比轮钱三百文，水一斗，煮取三升，候温服之。 【《千金方》】
    　　沙石淋痛：古文钱煮汁服。 【《普济方》】
    　　小便淋疾：温水和云母粉服三钱。

    　　血淋沙淋，小便濇痛：用黄烂浮石为末，每服二钱，生甘草煎汤调服。 【《直指方》】
    　　石淋破血：浮石满一手为末，以酢一升，水三升和煮二升，澄清，每服一升愈。 【《适用方》】
    　　石淋：取细白砂三斤炒热，以酒三升淋汁服一合，日再服。
    　　小便淋痛：石燕子七枚，捣黍米大新桑根白皮三两拌匀，分作七贴，每贴用水一盏煎七分，空心午前各一服。【《济众方》】[120p]

    Comprehensive Collection of Books Past and Present, Volume 270

    Methods for Treating Dysuria and Urinary Problems

    Simple Formulas

    1. For painful urination: Grind two taels of true zhen ding porcelain and one tael each of raw and cooked rehmannia. Use two qian each time and boil with mutong to drink.

    2. For sudden dysuria: Burn one tael of good ink into powder and take one qian with warm water.

    3. For dysuria with gas: Use 300 wen of copper coins, one dou of water, and boil to obtain three sheng. Allow it to cool and drink.

    4. For painful urination due to sand or stones: Boil ancient coins’ juice to drink.

    5. For painful urination: Mix three qian of muscovite powder with warm water.

    6. For blood dysuria or sand dysuria with painful urination: Use yellow rotten floating stone powdered, take two qian, and mix with decoction of raw licorice for drinking.

    7. For dysuria with stones and bleeding: Take one hand full of floating stone powder, mix it with one sheng of vinegar and three sheng of water, boil down to two sheng, clarify and take one sheng each time for recovery.

    8. For stone dysuria: Heat three jin of fine white sand, mix with three sheng of wine to extract juice, take one ge (a measure) and repeat two times a day.

    9. For painful urination: Take seven swallow stones, pound them together with three taels of fresh mulberry root’s white bark that is the size of millet, mix evenly, divide into seven doses. Each dose requires one cup of water boiled for seven minutes, to be taken on an empty stomach before noon each day.[120p]

    　　血淋心烦：石燕子、商陆、赤小豆、红花等分为末，每服一钱，葱白汤调下。
    　　漏精血浊：雪白盐一两，并筑紧固济，煅一日，出火毒，白茯苓、山药各一两为末，枣肉和蜜丸梧子大。每枣汤下三十丸。盖甘以济咸，脾肾两得也。
    　　五种淋疾：劳淋、气淋、血淋、热淋、石淋，及小便不通至甚者，用透格散。硝石一两，不夹泥土，雪白者生研为末。每服二钱，各依汤使。劳淋劳倦虚损，小便不出，小腹急痛，葵子末煎汤下，通后便须服补虚丸散。小便不出，时下血，疼痛满急，血淋也；小便热赤色，脐下急痛，热淋也，并用冷水调下。气淋小腹满急，尿后常有余沥，木通煎汤下。石淋茎内痛，尿不能出，内引小腹膨胀急痛，尿下砂石，令人闷绝，将药末先入搅匀隔纸炒至纸焦为度，再研用温水调下。小便不通，小麦汤下。卒患诸淋，只以冷水下，并空心调药，使硝如水乃服之。【《灵苑方》】[121p]

    Translation of the Classical Chinese text:

    For bleeding and heart disturbance: Mix shiyanzi (stone swallow), shanglu, red bean, and safflower into a powder. Take one qian with scallion white soup.

    For leakage of essence with turbid blood: Take one liang of white salt, tightly bound as needed, and calcine for one day to expel toxic heat. Then grind one liang each of white poria and yam into powder, combine with jujube flesh and honey to make pills the size of walnuts. Take thirty pills with jujube soup.

    For five types of dysuria: Labor dysuria, qi dysuria, blood dysuria, heat dysuria, and stone dysuria, as well as severe cases of difficult urination, use the Tongge powder. Take one liang of nitre that does not contain soil—make sure it is pure white and grind it into powder. Take two qian each time, with suitable soup.

    Labor dysuria results from weakness and fatigue; symptoms include inability to urinate and urgent pain in the lower abdomen. Take a decoction of perilla seed powder. After urinating, one must take restorative pills or powder.

    For inability to urinate, accompanied by a small amount of blood and urgent pain, this is blood dysuria; reddish-yellow urine and sharp pain below the navel indicate heat dysuria; both should be treated with cold water.

    For qi dysuria with fullness and urgency in the lower abdomen, and frequent residual dribbling after urination, take a decoction of mutong (bladderpod). For stone dysuria with internal pain and inability to urinate, leading to urgent pain and swelling in the lower abdomen, and urination of sand or stones causing distress, first mix the powder, stir it well, and fry between paper until the paper is scorched, then grind it and use warm water to take.

    For cases of inability to urinate, use a decoction of wheat. For sudden cases of dysuria, simply take with cold water, and set the medicine in an empty stomach so that the nitre dissolves like water before consuming it.[121p]

    　　气虚白浊：黄芪盐炒半两，茯苓一两为末，每服一钱，白汤下。 【《经验良方》】
    　　沙淋石淋：人参焙，黄芪盐水炙，等分为末，用红皮大萝卜一枚，切作四片，以蜜二两将萝卜逐片蘸炙，令干再炙，勿令焦，以蜜尽为度，每用一片蘸药食之，仍以盐汤送下，以瘥为度。【《三因方》】
    　　小便卒淋：萎蕤一两，芭蕉根四两，水二大碗，煎一碗半，入滑石二钱，分三服。 【《圣惠方》】
    　　小便卒淋：紫草一两为散，每食前用井华水服二钱。 【《千金翼》】[122p]

    • Qi Deficiency with Turbid Urine: Half a liang of astragalus roasted with salt, one liang of poria finely ground. Take one qian each time, to be taken with white broth.
    • Sand and Stone Lin: Roasted ginseng, roasted astragalus with salt water, ground evenly. Use one large red-skinned radish, cut into four pieces, dipping each piece in two liang of honey and roasting it again until dry, but do not let it burn, using honey until finished. Take one piece dipped in the medicinal powder each time, and follow it with salty broth until cured.
    • Sudden Lin in Urination: One liang of rheum, four liang of banana root, boil with two large bowls of water until reduced to one and a half bowls, then add two qian of talc, divided into three doses.
    • Sudden Lin in Urination: One liang of purple grass as a powder, taken with two qian before each meal using well water.[122p]

    　　血淋热痛：黄芩一两，水煎热服。 【《千金方》】
    　　小便血淋濇痛：山慈姑花同地蘗花阴干，每用二钱，水煎服。 【《圣惠方》】
    　　小便热淋：白茅根四升，水一斗五升，煮取五升，适冷暖饮之，日三服。 【《肘后方》】
    　　血淋热淋：白薇、芍药各一两为末，酒服方寸匕，日三服。 【《千金方》】
    　　小便气淋，结濇不通：白芷酢浸焙干二两为末，煎木通、甘草，酒调下一钱，连进二服。【《普济方》】
    　　小便五淋：赤芍药一两，槟榔一个，面裹煨为末。每服一钱，水一盏煎七分，空心服。【《博济方》】
    　　小便浑独如精：木香、当归、没药等分为末，以刺棘心自然汁和丸梧子大。每食前盐汤下三十丸。【《普济方》】
    　　白浊腹满，不拘男妇：用益智仁盐水浸炒，厚朴姜汁炒等分，姜三片，枣一枚，水煎服。【《永类钤方》】
    　　小便淋沥：生续断捣绞汁服，即马蓟根也。 【《古今录验》】[123p]

    Blood Lin Syndrome with Heat and Pain: One ounce of Scutellaria, decocted in water and taken hot. 【"Qianjin Fang"】

    Blood Lin Syndrome with Urinary Pain: Dried flowers of Trichosanthes and Euphorbia, two taels each, decocted in water. 【"Shenghui Fang"】

    Heat Lin Syndrome: Four sheng of Imperata root and one dou five sheng of water, boiled to yield five sheng, consumed warm or cool, three times daily. 【"Zhouhou Fang"】

    Blood Lin with Heat Lin: One ounce each of Rehmannia and Peony, powdered, taken with a small spoonful of wine, three times a day. 【"Qianjin Fang"】

    Qi Lin with Blockage: Two taels of Bai Zhi soaked and dried, decocted with Mutong and Licorice, one qian adjusted with wine, taken in two doses. 【"Pujifang"】

    Five Lin Syndrome: One ounce of Red Peony, one Betel nut, powdered in flour. Take one qian, boil in one cup of water for seven minutes, consumed on an empty stomach. 【"Boji Fang"】

    Murky Urine like Essence: Equal parts of Muxiang, Angelica, and Myrrh powdered, mixed with juice from the fresh thorny heart and formed into pills the size of a walnut. Take thirty pills before meals with salty broth. 【"Pujifang"】

    Milky Abdomen, regardless of gender: Use Yizhi kernel soaked in salt water and stir-fried, combined with thick-fried Magnolia bark and ginger juice in equal parts, adding three slices of ginger and one date, decocted in water. 【"Yonglei Qianfang"】

    Dripping Urine: Fresh Rehmannia is pounded and squeezed for juice to be consumed, which refers to the root of Cirsium. 【"Gujin Luxian"】[123p]

    　　小便血淋：苎根煎汤，频服大妙。亦治诸淋。 【《圣惠方》】
    　　五种淋疾：苎麻根两茎打碎，以水一碗半，煎半碗，顿服即通，大妙。 【《斗门方》】
    　　沙石热淋：马蔺花七枚，烧故笔头二七枚，烧粟米二合炒为末。每服三钱酒下，日二服。名通神散。
    　　男妇血淋，亦治五淋多年：煮酒瓶头箬叶，三五年至十年者尤佳，每用七个烧存性，入麝香少许，陈米饮下，日三服。有人患此，二服愈。【《百一选方》】
    　　尿白如注，小腹气痛：茶笼内箬叶烧存性，入麝香少许，米饮下。 【《经验方》】
    　　血淋濇痛：芭蕉根、旱莲草各等分，水煎服。 【《圣惠方》，下同】
    　　小便血淋：生地黄汁、车前叶汁各三合，和煎服。
    　　小便淋痛，或尿血，或砂石胀痛：用川牛膝一两，水二盏，煎一盏，温服。一妇人患此十年，服之得效。杜牛膝亦可，或入麝香、乳香为良。[124p]

    Blood in Urine: Decoction of ramie root, taken frequently is remarkably effective. It also treats various types of dysuria.

    Five Types of Dysuria: Two stalks of ramie root crushed, boiled with one and a half cups of water to yield half a cup, taken all at once for immediate relief.

    Sandstone Heat Dysuria: Seven flowers of horse weed, twenty-seven burnt old pen tips, twenty-seven grains of fried corn ground into powder. Take three qian with wine, twice a day, known as Tongshen Powder.

    For Men and Women with Blood Dysuria, also treating long-term dysuria: Boil the tips of wine bottles wrapped in banana leaves, those aged three to ten years are especially good. Use seven of them, add a little musk, and drink with aged rice wine, three times a day. Some patients recovered after two doses.

    Urine as White as Water, with Lower Abdominal Pain: Burn banana leaves in a tea holder until charred, add a little musk, and drink with rice wine.

    Blood Dysuria with Sharp Pain: Equal parts of banana root and dry lotus grass, boiled and consumed.

    Blood Dysuria: Juices of fresh rehmannia and plantago leaves, three he, mixed and taken as a decoction.

    Dysuria with Pain, Blood in Urine, or Sandstone Distension Pain: One liang of Sichuan achyranthes, boiled with two cups of water to yield one cup, taken warm.     Here is the translated text:

    Another formula: Boil salt and apply it hot to the lower abdomen; use cold as a replacement. This also treats blood in urination.

    For heat strangury: Take twenty-seven jujubes, one sheng of sunflower roots (cut), use the seeds in winter and the seedlings in summer; cook these two ingredients with three sheng of water to obtain one sheng and two drachms, divide into two doses. For heat, add one tael of Huangqin (Scutellaria), if difficult, add two taels of powdered talcum; for blood, add three taels of Madder root, and for pain, add two taels of Peony. When adding herbs, also add water.

    For blood strangury: Use five sheng of water to boil ten pieces of raw hemp root, then take two sheng and drink it all at once. This also treats blood in urination.

    For sand and stone strangury: Take 120 black beans and one sheng of powdered herbs, decoct in water, then while hot mix in one qian of powdered talcum and take it on an empty stomach.

    Another formula: To treat painful urination with sand or stones, or red dysentery: take a handful of daylily roots, crush and extract the juice to drink, or boil and eat the young shoots.

    Another formula: For pain during urination, this is due to stagnation of qi and heat in the liver channel; use only sweet licorice stems, decoct with water, and take on an empty stomach.

    For pain in the navel due to qi strangury: Take salt and vinegar together.

    For fright and palpitations with nocturnal emissions: Fry wood fungus and white morning glory equally and grind to powder. Take two qian with rice drink to wash down.

    　　《千金方》曰：气淋，脐中着盐，灸二壮。　　又法：灸关元五十壮；又灸侠玉泉相去一寸半，三十壮。　　石淋，脐下三十六种病，不得小便，灸关元三十壮；又灸气门三十壮；又灸水泉三十壮，足大敦是也。　　劳淋，灸足太阴百壮，在内踝上三寸，三报之。　　血淋，灸丹田随年壮；又灸伏留五十壮。 【一云随年壮。】　　五淋不得小便，灸悬泉十四壮，穴在内踝前一寸，斜行小脉上，是中封之别名。　　五淋，灸大敦三十壮。
    　　卒淋，灸外踝尖七壮。[142p]

    • For painful and dripping urination: Take five qian of yellow skin from chicken gizzard, dry it and burn to retain its nature, prepare as one dose, and consume with plain water for immediate relief.

    　　　　导引

    　　《古今医统》曰：遗精法，半夜子时分，阳正兴时，仰卧，瞑目闭口，舌顶上腭，将腰拱起，左手用中指顶住尾闾穴，右手用大指顶住无名指根拳着，又将两腿俱伸，两脚十指俱抠，提起一口气，心中存想脊背脑后，上贯至顶门，慢慢直下至丹田，方将腰腿脾手从容放下，再照前行，阳则衰矣；如阳未衰，再行二三次如初行时。阳未兴，勉强兴之方可行。夫人之所以有虚疾者，因年少欲心太盛，房事过多，水火不能相济，以致此疾。[144p]

    能行此法，不惟速去泄精之病，久而肾气上升，心火下降，则水火既济，永无疾病矣。　　又法：遗精不禁，以床铺安短窄，卧如弓，湾二膝并脐缩，或左或右侧卧，用手扎阴囊，一手伏丹田，切须宁心静卧，戒除房室思欲之事，因精不泄，可保身矣。　　又法：侧身曲卧，戌亥之间，一手兜外肾，二手搓脐下八十一次，然后换手，每手各九次，兜搓九日见效八十一日成功。　　《保生秘要》曰：白浊白带导引法，肾俞、气海各掐九九，擦之亦然，兼运后功。[145p]

    　　　　医案

    　　《儒门事亲》曰：戴人过息城，一男子病淋，戴人令顿食咸鱼，少顷大渴；戴人令恣意饮水，然后以药治淋，立通。淋者无水，故濇也。
    　　酒监房善良之子年十三，病沙石淋已九年矣。初因疮疹余毒不出，作便血。或告之服太白散，稍止。后又因积热未退，变成淋闭，每发则见鬼神，号则惊邻。戴人诊之曰：诸医作肾与小肠病者非也。《灵枢》言足厥阴肝之经，病遗溺闭癃。闭谓小溲不行，癃为淋沥。此乙木之病，非小肠与肾也。木为所抑，火来乘之，故热在脬中，下焦为之约，结成沙石，如汤瓶煎炼日久，熬成汤碱。夫羊豕之脬，吹气令满，常不能透，岂有真沙石而能漏者邪？故知前人所说，服五石丸散而致者，恐未尽然。经曰：木郁则达之，先以瓜蒂散越之，次以八正散加汤碱等分顿啜之，沙石自化而下。[148p]

    Medical Case

    The "Rituals of Serving Parents" states: A man from Dai passed through Xi City, where a young man suffered from schistosomiasis. The man from Dai instructed him to eat salted fish, and soon he became very thirsty; then the man from Dai allowed him to drink as much water as he wanted, and afterward treated the schistosomiasis with medicine, which immediately relieved his symptoms. The patient experienced difficulty with urination, hence the condition worsened.

    The son of a liquor monitor, a kind-hearted boy of thirteen, had been suffering from sand-stone schistosomiasis for nine years. Initially, due to residual toxins from a rash, he experienced bloody stools. Someone advised him to take Taibai Powder, which provided some relief. However, due to the accumulation of heat that did not subside, he developed a blockage, which caused him to hallucinate, crying out and alarming the neighbors.

    The man from Dai diagnosed him, concluding that previous physicians incorrectly attributed the illness to the kidneys and small intestines. The "Ling Shu" states that the Liver channel of the Foot Jueyin relates to issues with urination and blockages. A blockage refers to the inability to urinate, while schistosomiasis is a kind of dripping. This is a disease related to the Wood element, not the small intestine nor the kidneys. The Wood element is suppressed, and Fire comes to overtake it, leading to heat accumulation in the bladder, which constricts and forms sand and stones, similar to a cooking pot simmering for an extended period, turning the water into alkaline residue.

    As for the bladder of sheep and pigs, when inflated with air, it cannot release anything; how can there truly be sand and stones that can leak? Thus, it is understood that what previous physicians described about taking Wushi Pills to resolve the issue may not be completely accurate. The classic text states: When Wood is obstructed, it must be addressed first with Gua Ti Powder to unblock it, and then followed by Ba Zheng Powder mixed with alkaline water in equal parts, to be consumed in sips, allowing the sand and stones to dissolve and pass.[148p]

    　　屈村张氏小儿年十四岁，病约一年半矣。得之麦秋，发则小肠大痛，至握其茎，跳跃转旋，号呼不已，小溲数日不能下，下则成沙石，大便秘濇，肛门脱出一二寸。诸医莫能治，乃负其子而哀请戴人。戴人曰：今日治，今日效。时日在辰巳间矣。以调胃承气仅一两，加牵牛头末三钱，汲河水煎之，令作三五度咽之。又服苦末，丸如芥子许六十粒。日加晡，上涌下泄，一时齐出，有脓有血。涌泻既觉定，令饮新汲水一大盏，小溲已利一二次矣。是夜凡饮新水二三十遍，病去九分，止哭一次。明日困卧如醉，自晨至暮，猛然起走，索食，与母歌笑自得，顿释所苦。继与太白散、八正散等，调一日，大瘥。恐暑天失所养，皆五日而归。戴人曰：此下焦约也。不吐不下，则下焦何以开？不令饮水，则小溲何以利？大抵源清则流清也。[149p]

    The young boy of the Zhang family from Qucun is fourteen years old and has been ill for about a year and a half. The illness began in the wheat harvest season, manifesting as severe abdominal pain with spasms, leading him to grip his abdomen, jump, twist, and cry out without ceasing. He experienced a few days of difficulty urinating, only managing to do so in small amounts resembling sand and stones, while his bowel movements were severely constipated, causing his rectum to protrude one to two inches. Many doctors were unable to cure him, so he was carried by his father to seek the help of a healer. The healer stated: "Today's treatment will yield results today." It was around the hour of Chen and Si.

    Using a formula to regulate the stomach and relieve heat, with a mere one or two taels, he added three qian of cowherb root powder, boiled it in river water, and instructed him to swallow it three to five times. He also took a bitter powder in the form of sixty tiny pills the size of mustard seeds. After these treatments, he experienced a rush of vomiting and diarrhea all at once, with pus and blood expelled. Once the purging settled, he was instructed to drink a large bowl of freshly drawn water, which immediately aided his urination one or two times. That night, he drank fresh water twenty to thirty times, and nearly all of his illness was alleviated, with only one instance of crying remaining.

    The next day, he lay down as if drunk, from morning until dusk, and suddenly got up to run about, seeking food, laughing and singing with his mother, finally free from his suffering. He then followed this with prescriptions like Taibai powder and Bazheng powder, adjusting his treatment over one day, leading to a complete recovery. Concerned that he might lose the nourishment during the hot weather, he returned after five days. The healer remarked: "This was a blockage in the lower yang. If there was no vomiting or bowel movement, how could the lower yang be opened? If one does not drink water, how can urination improve? Generally speaking, if the source is clean, then the flow will be clear."[149p]

    　　柏亭刘十三之子年六岁，病沙石淋，戴人以苦剂三涌之，以益肾散三下之，立愈。
    　　鹿邑一阀阅家，有子二十三岁，病膏淋三年。乡中医不能治，住京师遍访，多作虚损。补以温燥，灼以针艾，无少减。戴人曰：惑蛊之疾也，亦曰白淫。实由少腹热，非虚也。可以涌以泄。其人以时暑，惮其法峻，不决者三日。浮屠一僧曰：予以暑病，近觉头痛。戴人曰：亦可涌，愿与君同之，毋畏也！于是涌痰三升，色如黑矾汁，内有死血并黄绿水，又泻积秽数行，寻觉病去。方其来时，面无人色，及治毕，次日面如醉。戴人虑其暑月路远，又处数方，使归以自备云。[150p]

    　　《卫生宝鉴》曰：至元己巳，上都住，夏月，太保刘仲晦使引进史柔明来曰：近一两月作伴数人皆有淋疾，是气运使然，是水土耶？予思之，此间别无所患，此疾独公所有之，殆非运气水土使然。继问柔明，近来公多食甚物？曰：宣使赐木瓜百余对，遂多蜜煎之，每客至以此待食，日三五次。予曰；淋由此也。《内经》曰：酸多食之令人癃。可与太保言之，夺饮则已。一日，太保见予问曰：酸味致淋，其理安在？予曰：小便主气。《针经》云：酸入于胃，其气濇以收，上之两焦，弗能出入也。不出则留胃中，胃中和温则下注膀胱之胞，胞薄以懦，得酸则缩绻，约而不通，水道不行，故癃而濇，乃作淋也。又曰：阴之所生，本在五味；阴之五官，伤在五味。五味口嗜而欲食之，必自裁制，勿使过焉。五味过则皆能伤其正，岂止酸味耶？太保叹曰：凡为人子，不可不知医。信哉！[152p]

    One man, who habitually experienced seminal emission, also suffered heel pain, dryness of the mouth, thirst, and constipation in the afternoon. He was treated with a formula to tonify the spleen and benefit Qi, adding Shaoyao and Yuanshen, along with Liuwuwei Wan, and he recovered.

    　　朱工部劳则遗精，齿牙即痛，用补中益气加半夏、茯苓、芍药，并六味地黄丸渐愈，更以十全大补加麦门、五味而痊。
    　　一男子白浊梦遗，口干作渴，大便闭濇，午后热甚，用补中益气加芍药、元参，并加减八味丸而愈。
    　　举人陈履贤色欲过度，丁酉孟冬发热无时，饮水不绝，遗精不止，小便淋沥。或用四物芩连之类，前证益甚，更加痰涎上涌，口舌生疮；服二陈、黄蘗、知母之类，胸膈不利，饮食少思；更加枳壳、香附，肚腹作胀，大便不实，脉浮大，按之微细。余朝用四君为主，佐以熟地、当归，夕用加减八味丸，更以附子唾津调搽涌泉穴，渐愈。后用十全大补汤，其大便不通，小腹作胀，此直肠干濇，令猪胆通之，形体殊倦，痰热顿增，急用独参汤而安，再用煎药而愈。但劳发热无时，其脉浮洪。余谓其当慎起居，否则难治。彼以余言为迂，至乙巳夏复作，乃服四物、黄蘗、知母而殁。[159p]

    Zhu Gongbu, through excessive labor, experienced seminal emissions and tooth pain. To remedy this, he took Bu Zhong Yi Qi Decoction with Ban Xia, Fu Ling, and Shao Yao, gradually improving; he then added Shi Quan Da Bu Tang, with Mai Men Dong and Wu Wei Zi, resulting in recovery.

    A candidate, Chen Luxian, had excessive desires and experienced fever without respite in the winter of Ding You.     In the morning, I prescribed Si Jun Zi Tang as the primary formula, supplemented with Shu Di and Dang Gui, and at night, added a modified Ba Wei Wan. I further used Fu Zhi to rub and stimulate the Yong Quan acupoint, leading to gradual improvement. Later, I prescribed Shi Quan Da Bu Tang, but due to constipation and abdominal distension—in connection with rectal dryness—I advised the use of pig bile to alleviate this; he also felt exceptionally fatigued, and phlegm-heat surged. An urgent application of Du Shen Tang stabilized the condition, followed by a decoction that helped with recovery.     　　一男子食少胸满，手足逆冷，饮食畏寒发热吐痰，时欲作呕。自用清气化痰及二陈、枳实之类，胸腹膨胀，呕吐痰食，小便淋漓；又用四苓、连、蘗、知母、车前，小便不利，诸病益甚。余曰：此脾胃虚寒无火之证，故食入不消而反出。遂用八味丸补火以生土，用补中益气加姜、桂培养中宫，生发阳气，寻愈。[160p]

    A man experienced little appetite, a feeling of fullness in the chest, coldness in his hands and feet, and was sensitive to cold, leading to heat, phlegm, and occasional nausea.     　　司马李梧山茎中作痛，小便如淋，口干唾痰。此思色精降而内败，用补中益气，六味地黄而愈。
    　　下堡顾仁成年六十有一，痢后入房，精滑自遗，二日方止。又房劳感寒，怒气，遂发寒热，右胁痛连心胸，腹痞，自汗盗汗如雨，四肢厥冷，睡中惊悸，或觉上升如浮，或觉下陷如坠，遂致废寝。或用补药二剂益甚，脉浮大洪数，按之微细。此属无火虚热，急与十全大补加山药、山茱萸、丹皮、附子一剂，诸证顿愈而痊。此等元气，百无一二。

    　　《古今医统》曰：郑宪使之子年十六，生七个月后得淋病，五七日必一作，其发则大痛，水道下如漆如粟者一盏方定。脉之轻则濇，重则弦，视其形瘦而长，色青而苍。意其必因其父服热药，遗热在胎，留于子之命门而然，遂以紫雪和黄蘗末丸梧桐子大，晒干，热汤下百丸，半日又下二百丸，食物压之。又半日，痛大作连腰腹，水道乃行，下漆如粟者碗许，痛减十之八。后与陈皮一两，桔梗、木通各半两，又下一合许而安。父得燥热，尚能病子，况母得之者乎？
    　　《医贯》曰：予治郑鲁叔，二十余岁攻举子业，四鼓犹未卧，遂病，卧间玉茎但着被与腿，便梦交接脱精，悬空则不梦，饮食日减，倦怠少气。此用心太过，二火俱起，夜不得睡，血不归肝，肾水不足，火乘阴虚，入客下焦，鼓其精房，则精不得聚藏而欲走。因玉茎着物，犹厥气客之，故作接内之梦。于是上补心安神，中调脾胃升其阳，下用益精生阴固阳之剂，不三月而安。[162p]

    The "Ancient and Modern Medical System" states: Zheng Xian's son, at the age of sixteen, developed a disease resembling dysuria seven months after birth.     In the past, there was a practitioner in Wu Zhao Mountain who understood the method for treating nocturnal emissions. He treated a man who, after becoming ill, overworked his mind and thus developed the problem of dreaming of emissions. The man was thin and phlegmatic, and various doctors prescribed a cleansing heart with lotus seed drink, which was ineffective over time. Upon diagnosing his pulse as tight and rough, I realized that the use of cold and diuretic medicine was excessive, resulting in the decline of kidney energy, which would worsen his condition. I employed a method of elevation, raising the water of Kan to assist the fire of Li, reducing Yang energy while nourishing Yin blood. Then, I used deer antler glue and human milk to replenish essence and blood. In less than a month, he was cured.

    I reflected on the multiple causes of nocturnal emissions, which make treatment difficult. Some are caused by excessive mental heat leading to leakage, while others result from overconsumption of cold diuretic medicines like Ophiopogon, Poria, Plantago, Anemarrhena, and Coptis, which also lead to leakage. There are also cases of prolonged leakage without closure at the Yumen (Jade Gate). For treatment, those with excessive heat should clear the heart and diminish fire; those affected by cold and diuretic medicines should warm and tonify the lower origin; and those with declining kidney energy should elevate and retrieve energy, allowing the water and fire to interact so that Kan and Li can stabilize naturally.[163p]
